intro: Mabea pallida, commonly known as the pale mabea, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Mabea pallida is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
